original: Mellander, Carl Einar Natanael, ad-volkat, ombudsman, Göteborg, f. 20/3/ 87 li BjörketoTp, Älvsb. k, av Carl M. o. Gerda Pettersson. G. 19 m. Elsa Ja-kobsison. Barn I Carl-O lo v f. 20, regissör, Sthlm, Ingrid 22, Hans-Gösta 25, Kerstin 30, Carl-Einar 37. — Mogi-ex. 07, jur. kand. 12, stud. nat lekon. o. finirätt i Gbg 13, i Sthlm 16-17. E. O’, not. i Göta hovr. 13, tingstjg. o. dom I förordn. 13-15, aman. o. dir lassist. v. Svies redarefören. 18-22, omb iman h. Axel Broström & Son, Angf. A-B Tirfiing, Ångf. A-B Ferm, Sv. Orient-linj.. Sv. Amer. Lin., Sv. Amer. Mexiko Lin., Sv. Ostasiat. Komp., Gö-taverken, Eriksbergs Mek. Verkst., Broströms Linjeag., A-B Bunkeroljor, red ibol. Motorfart, Motortank o. Gbg-Frederiiiksb. Linj., Hall. Ångb. A-B, Gbgs Bogseri- & Bärgn. A-B, Nora Bergsl. Järnv. A-B m. fl. sed. 23, verkst. dir. i A-B Broströms jur. avd. sed. 42. Styr iled. i flera sjöf isamman-silutn. Stadsfullm. 27-34. Skr. i Synpunkter ifråga om rederiernas be-skattn. efter kriget. RVO.
translated: Mellander, Carl Einar Natanael, honorary consul, official, Gothenburg, b. 20/3/87 in BjörketoTp, Älvsb. parish, son of Carl M. and Gerda Pettersson. Married in 19xx to Elsa Ja-kobsison. Children: Carl-Olof, b. 1920, director, Stockholm; Ingrid, b. 1922; Hans-Gösta, b. 1925; Kerstin, b. 1930; Carl-Einar, b. 1937. Completed secondary school in 1907, received a law degree in 1912, studied natural science at the University of Gothenburg in 1913, and in Stockholm from 1916-1917. Became a trainee lawyer in the Göta Court of Appeal in 1913, served as a judge and magistrate from 1913-1915, assistant and director at the Swedish Shipowners' Association from 1918-1922, ombudsman at Axel Broström & Son, Angf. A-B Tirfiing, Ångf. A-B Ferm, Swedish Orient Line, Swedish American Line, Swedish American Mexican Line, Swedish East Asia Company, Göta Works, Eriksberg Mek. Verkst., Broströms Linjeag., A-B Bunkeroljor, motor fleet, motor tank, and Gbg-Frederiksb. Line, Hall. Ångb. A-B, Gbg Tugboat & Salvage A-B, Nora Bergsl. Railway A-B, and others since 1923, managing director of the legal department at A-B Broströms since 1942. Member of several maritime associations. City council member from 1927-1934. Wrote about the taxation of shipping after the war. Received the Order of the Vasa.

publications.name: Synpunkter ifråga om rederiernas beskattn. efter kriget
